alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 2:57PM MST until February 28 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Fremont County in central Wyoming... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 256 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Red Canyon, or 15 miles southeast of Lander, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Red Canyon and Johnny Lee's Corner. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
